turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Heartbreak on a Full Moon.
turn.1: Was Heartbreak on a Full Moon a successful album?
turn.2: On November 8, 2017, "Heartbreak on a Full Moon" was certified gold by the Recording Industry Association of America for combined sales and album-equivalent units of over 500,000 units in the United States (in this case, 250,000 double album sets, which are double-counted by the RIAA).
turn.4: Brown became the first R&B male artist that went gold in a week since Usher's "Confessions" in 2004.
turn.5: What other awards did the album win?
turn.6: In its second chart week, the album remained at number three on "Billboard 200", with 73,000 album-equivalent units.
turn.7: Did it win any other awards?
turn.8: In Australia, it entered the ARIA Albums Chart at number five, becoming his first top ten in the nation since "X" in 2014.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In the United Kingdom, the album debuted at number 10 on the UK Albums Chart, Brown's sixth non-consecutive top 10 album on the chart.
turn.11: Did it win any other awards?
turn.12: The album was eventually certified Silver by the British Phonographic Industry (BPI) for sales of over 60,000 copies in the UK.
